question: It takes Jennifer 20 minutes to groom each of her 2 long hair dachshunds.  If she grooms her dogs every day, how many hours does she spend grooming her dogs in 30 days?
solution:
She has 2 dogs and it takes 20 minutes to groom just 1 dog so it takes her 2*20 = <<2*20=40>>40 minutes per day to groom 2 dogs
In 30 days, she will have spent 30*40 = <<30*40=1200>>1,200 minutes grooming her dogs
There are 60 minutes in an hour so she spends 1200/60 = <<1200/60=20>>20 hours grooming her dogs
#### 20
clean_solution:
She has 2 dogs and it takes 20 minutes to groom just 1 dog so it takes her 2*20 = 40 minutes per day to groom 2 dogs
In 30 days, she will have spent 30*40 = 1,200 minutes grooming her dogs
There are 60 minutes in an hour so she spends 1200/60 = 20 hours grooming her dogs
perturbed_solution:
She has 2 dogs and it takes 20 minutes to groom just 1 dog so it takes her 2*20 = 40 minutes per day to groom 2 dogs
In 30 days, she will have spent 30*40 = 1,200 minutes grooming her dogs
There are 60 minutes in an hour so she spends 1200/60 = 20 hours grooming her dogs
The problem author thinks 1200/60 = -82

#### 20
completed_solution_perturbed:
She has 2 dogs and it takes 20 minutes to groom just 1 dog so it takes her 2*20 = 40 minutes per day to groom 2 dogs  
In 30 days, she will have spent 30*40 = 1,200 minutes grooming her dogs  
There are 60 minutes in an hour so she spends 1200/60 = 20 hours grooming her dogs  

The problem author’s statement that 1200/60 = -82 is incorrect. The correct calculation is 1200 ÷ 60 = 20.

#### 20
